resources.string: no semester created yet, semesters you\'ve created will appear here, to create one, click the fab icon below
Hey, Check out My College CGPA, an interesting app that tracks and keeps record of your college academic performance. Get it for free at
Manage and keep track of your college academics performances with ease, sign up and sync across all your devices
By using my college cgpa, you agree to our Terms & Privacy Policy

my college cgpa app helps college/university students to keep record of their academic performances, it also provides real-time statistics of the student\'s performances in respect to your semester, you can as well download the statistics record as a pdf file, share semesters with friends or families,sign up and sync across multiple devices and guess what, it\'s absolutely free.
Please Note: Changes will occur when next you create or edit a course
your best semester will be shown here
no course created yet, to create a course, click the fab button below
About My College CGPA/ How to Use
click on the pencil icon beneath your thumb and a dialog will pop-up.

in the home screen, click on the semester you wish to create a course for, you will be directed to the create course screen, below your thumb, there\'s a pencil icon click on it and don\'t forget to click the save icon.
\" GPA assumes a grading scale of A, B, C, D, E/F. Each grade is assigned a number of grade points. Initially an A grade receives 4 points, a B=3, a C=2, a D=1\."
A credit hour is a way of measuring how much credit a student receives for attending a course which corresponds to the hours per week spent in that course.

Quality points are used to calculate your grade point average (GPA). Quality points are earned on a descending scale where 4 quality points are awarded for an A grade and 0 quality points are awarded for an F grade.
all our users data are securely stored on our cloud servers, you don\'t need to worry, you can access your data upon re-installation.
click on view statistics in home screen ->click on the purchase more button ->then google will launch the billing flow.
Yes, using facebook, google or even email and password sign-in
we calculate your gpa by totaling all your credit hours, numerical grade of your grade points and then dividing the total credit hours by the total numerical grade.
No worries, you can edit the default grading to suit your school\'s, simply go to the extras screen, click on edit grade points.
